text: Masolino da Panicale (common name Tommaso di Cristoforo Fini, born around 1383 in Panicale, died 1447 in Florence) was an Italian painter. He is commonly known as Masolino. Among his best-known works are frescoes in the Brancacci Chapel, and a madonna called Madonna and Child with St. Anne. He painted the madonna together with another artist, commonly known as Masaccio. ==Related pages== * Italian Renaissance art * List of Italian painters Category:1380s births Category:1440s deaths Category:15th-century Italian painters
title: Masolino da Panicale
